title.value: scHiCyclePred: a deep learning framework for predicting cell cycle phases from single-cell Hi-C data using multi-scale interaction information
title.justification: This is clearly the title of the paper as stated at the beginning and reiterated in various sections.
title.quote: scHiCyclePred: a deep learning framework for predicting cell cycle phases from single-cell Hi-C data using multi-scale interaction information

extractions.description: This paper introduces scHiCyclePred, a deep learning framework designed to predict cell cycle phases using single-cell Hi-C data. By extracting and integrating multi-scale interaction information, the model offers improved accuracy in predicting cell cycle stages, outperforming other methods like NAGANO and CIRCLET.

type.justification: The paper involves the development, implementation, and empirical evaluation of a deep learning model using metrics such as accuracy, F1 Score, AUC, and AP.
type.quote: We introduce scHiCyclePred, a model that utilizes single-cell Hi-C's multi-scale interaction data to predict cell cycle phases by extracting chromatin's 3D features.

name.justification: The study involves computational prediction models and the extraction of biological data features, focusing on single-cell Hi-C data and chromatin structure.
name.quote: scHiCyclePred: a deep learning framework for predicting cell cycle phases from single-cell Hi-C data using multi-scale interaction information

name.justification: The research involves using machine learning techniques including deep learning frameworks to predict cell cycle phases.
name.quote: We develop a fusion-prediction model that integrates the three feature sets generated by the convolution module.

name.justification: The study deals with chromatin's 3D features and data obtained from single-cell Hi-C, key areas in genomics.
name.quote: We introduce scHiCyclePred, a model that utilizes single-cell Hi-C's multi-scale interaction data to predict cell cycle phases by extracting chromatin's 3D features.

name.justification: scHiCyclePred is the main model proposed in the paper, integrating three feature sets into a unified vector for cell cycle phase prediction.
name.quote: We introduce scHiCyclePred, a model that utilizes single-cell Hi-C's multi-scale interaction data to predict cell cycle phases by extracting chromatin's 3D features.

is_contributed.justification: The model is a contribution of the paper, as it was specifically developed and introduced in this study.
is_contributed.quote: To overcome the hurdles of predicting cell cycle phases from single-cell Hi-C data, we present a computational framework, scHiCyclePred.

is_executed.justification: The scHiCyclePred framework was executed to test its performance against other models like NAGANO and CIRCLET.
is_executed.quote: We benchmark the performance of scHiCyclePred against existing methods and demonstrate that it outperforms them in predicting cell cycle phases.

is_compared.justification: The performance of scHiCyclePred was compared against other existing methods such as NAGANO, CIRCLET, and various machine learning techniques.
is_compared.quote: We compare the performance of scHiCyclePred with other popular methods, including NAGANO, CIRCLET, LR, SVM, and RF, in predicting cell cycle phases.

referenced_paper_title.value: Cell-cycle dynamics of chromosomal organization at single-cell resolution
referenced_paper_title.justification: The NAGANO method, one of the models used for comparison, is from this referenced paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For example, Nagano et al. obtained single-cell Hi-C data from mouse embryonic stem cells (ESCs) at different cell cycle stages and utilized machine learning algorithms to calculate the ‘repli-score’

name.justification: The NAGANO dataset is used extensively throughout the paper for training and testing the scHiCyclePred model and evaluating various metrics.
name.quote: we partition the NAGANO dataset into fifty independent training and testing sets by altering the random seeds, with the NAGANO dataset being the total of each training and testing set

referenced_paper_title.value: Cell-cycle dynamics of chromosomal organization at single-cell resolution
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the original paper that generated the NAGANO dataset used in this study for model evaluation.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For example, Nagano et al. obtained single-cell Hi-C data from mouse embryonic stem cells (ESCs) at different cell cycle stages

name.justification: TensorFlow is a popular deep learning library that might have been used to implement the scHiCyclePred model, though it is not explicitly mentioned in the given text.
name.quote: not explicitly mentioned in the text
